comment: TAKE HER!! This class was very easy and she puts forth effort to work with her students. I showed up 40 minutes late for the final because of traffic and she still let me take it (bless her). Quizzes are easy as long as you pay attention in class. Did not require much at home studying. A good bit of extra credit to help. Very caring professor!

Best professor i've had at KSU. She is very caring and if you pay attention to her lectures and show up to class you'll do great. She's very clear during lectures and makes sure to explain topics thoroughly. She also has a lot of extra credit opportunities which helped a lot for me!

I loved this professor! She made the lectures very interesting and easy, and the class overall was not hard. It was not hard at all to study for her class; you just read the powerpoints and take notes in class. Attendance wasn't mandatory, but she did have some in-class assignments.

Would take it again!!! She was a great professor and had easy lectures. Attendance wasn't mandatory but she did have random assignments that count towards your so its worth it to go to class. Her lecture slides are pretty easy to understand. If you just go to her lectures you'll pass.
Dr. Morris is a great professor and is always willing to help get your through the major! She is very approachable but also very straightforward with you for all the right reasons.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: (Cont'd) There's 1 major but super simple assignment. Literally as long as you come to class & pay attention, takes notes & make sure you understand the lecture powerpoints, there's no way you won't get an A. The semester isn't even done but I know I would definitely take her again for another class. There's a textbook but you can pass without it!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She's amazing. Attendance isn't mandatory but it'd be in your best interest to show up bc there are in class assignments that count and being in the lectures actually make a difference, plus the class isn't super long anyway. There's an in class quiz for each chapter and they're not hard at all. No tests, just quizzes, assignments, and a final.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: I love Professor Morris. This is my first time taken a class with her but trust me when I say she's your best bet. Her lectures are actually enjoyable because she isn't reading straight from them and she goes into detail with different examples and relating the information to real life. She's so sweet & you can tell she cares about her students.

She is sweet and will help you, just ask! Has a cumulative final that is 40% of your grade (per the program). 5 quizzes for each section of the ACSM EP-C exam. 4 parts to a professional prep assignment (not difficult!). Extra credit opportunities, take advantage of it! Lecture heavy and sometimes boring because it's a huge review course.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: This class was not laid out well and I felt like Dr. Morris was all over the place during the semester. The textbook, the lecture, and the quizzes don't fit together at points. The projects are fun/creative though and I enjoyed them. If you have her, pray you aren't working or taking other vigorous classes because this class takes lots of time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: If you can avoid her for upper-level classes I would. Her powerpoints are not what she quizzes over for senior seminar. She is friendly but does not need to teach upper-level courses. She does not know the answers to her own review questions. Good luck knowing what to study for her final or quizzes. You're better off reading the book exclusively.

The grades were laid out from the beginning.  Simply put if you show up you should be ok.  She does participation activities that weigh a decent amount for your grade.  Had about 6 quizzes.  Was offered extra credit.  Not a bad professor but only bad things is she reads off the power point.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Yikes. She is not a good teacher, especially for college level. All I can say, yikes.

Dr. Morris is a great professor! This was her first time teaching this class and I learned a lot. We had quizzes every day but it was just for participation. There is a midterm and a final. There was one assignment but the guidelines were clear. Nutrition and performance was an easy class in terms of material, there was just a lot of information.

I have taken Professor Morris for ES 2100 and ES 2200, and she is an angel. Participation and attendance is super important given its a CPR class. Easy assignments and exams as long as you put the effort in. She really wants her students to succeed! You get certified in Sports First Aid and AHA CPR/AED at the end of the course.

She shouldn't be teaching upper level ES classes at KSU. It is clear she is not well educated in the material she teaches. Other upper level teachers know their stuff in the program. Reads off the powerpoints word for word, mispronounces several words that even students know how to pronounce. Does not set clear grading rubrics. Sad class.

Great Professor have taken two classes with her and plan to continue taking exercise science classes with her. She has helped me learn a lot. She has a lot of graded assignments but it helps you learn the information.

Professor Morris really cares about her students! As long as you are reading the textbook which goes straight along with the lectures, you will do well! Lockdown browser quizzes (15 questions), assignments, and extra credit opportunities! I made quizlets for each test and was pleased with my grades. She wants to see you succeed!

The class itself was pretty easy but her teaching is what made things difficult. She doesn't really give you help if you need, she basically just tells you to look for the answer which is frustrating. Reading the chapters or looking at the powerpoints is all that's really needed for the quizzes. Also make sure to participate.

You have quizzes every other week which are kind of hard. The questions are tricky. The quizzes are lockdown & webcam. There are no other grades besides assignments she decides to add randomly but they are pretty easy. Zooms are lecture based and reads off power points. Has some extra credit opportunities.

I don't know why her rating is average. She deserves at least a 4.5. Took her over maymester and got an A. I could have easily finished the class in a week but decided to pace myself over two weeks. All we did was read chapters and took easy quizzes over it. We also had one discussion post and 3-4 tests from other required texts. She was wonderful!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She's very caring and loves her job. Her goal is to prepare her students for the field and future class. No homework, just 3 tests, a cumulative final exam, and participation. Attendance isn't necessarily mandatory but in-class assignments count towards the participation portion of your grade. You have to study the text book and take lecture notes.

Professor Morris is so far one of my favorite professors. She is so sweet & passionate about what she teaches, and provides real world examples. She will tell you about opportunities for you to broaden your resume. She gives random extra credit & random kahoots for grades- so go to class, even though not mandatory. She truly wants the best for you!

would not recommend taking her if you have to commute and arent always able to come to class because she does random participation grades that really hurt my grade when i just couldnt come into class. her powerpoints are posted before class so its easier to have them done before you get there. very nice lady and easy to contact outside of class
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Every class you go over the powerpoint of the chapter that you are going over for the week. The exams are much harder than what is learned in the class. But, you do take the final as the "pre-test". She also has quizzes every Friday that were only open from 10AM-11:30PM that same day which sucked. She is very nice though. Class is not mandatory.

Professor Morris is very sweet. I took her for physical activity in health & disease. This class is not an easy A. Her lectures are very vague and she doesn't seem to explain the material very well. Attendance is important because she gives assignments some days, so show up everyday. Quizzes and exams contribute to the rest of your grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Read before going to class. Online quizzes and tests, which open up on the weekends. Work in groups to study. Gives extra credit. Take pics of her ppt bc her tests and quizzes are based on the ppt and textbook. Really helpful teacher. Keep up with the material bc her kahoots are based on the chapters.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: She is a very sweet lady and the class is pretty easy. Just do not forget to take the online quizzes and complete the homework each week. There is also a discussion question posted online every other week. Even though the class is supposed to meet twice a week, she only holds class one day and the other day is online.

She is a nice lady, however she makes it your job to turn in assignments. Much of the work is done online and sometimes she would not remind you. The class is fairly easy and is similar to health class in high school.
Class can be fun and she makes class enjoyable. Her online stuff was kinda difficult. However, it is not a lot of points to worry about.

I love Ms. Morris. She is a great helpful teacher and her class is pretty easy. The only problem I had was all the online stuff. But it's not hard at all. She's a great teacher and I recommend taking her.
Doris Morris is awesome! Walk/Jog was a good time.
A very good friend. Really wants to help her students. Just attend class, study the guides, do the assignments, easy A

Nice lady. Doesn't waste your time. Gives study guides that tell you exactly what will be on the tests. Assignments are quick and easy. Quizzes are a pain but they are online so you can have the book in front of you as you take them. Extra credit available. Highly recommend.
Do the assignments, useless to come to class, she teaches nothing, read chapters take tests, you should get an a

Easy A+! Very nice instructor who cares about your progress. Tests are easy if you do the study guide. Book is necessary for the test and quizzes. Online quizzes are a pain, but she didn't write them. People are whining about the 6 hours required for exercise or volunteering. Lazy or self-centered are my best guesses for them!

Morris is a fairly easy professor, but she doesn't explain things in depth. The class itself is really easy if you just study the chapters. You have a critical thinking quiz at the end of each chapter. The worst part of the class is getting 6 hours of volunteer work in, or of physical activity. Overall a good class!
Not too bad of a class. Some of the assignments are really time consuming though and there are a few assignments that are unclear.

Class is really easy and Doris is awesome! Speaks clearly and is willing to help you whenever you need it. I studied the night before for all tests and made 2 A's and a B. Only annoying thing is getting an extra 6hrs of required physical activity. Overall good class
It's a easy class. She grades the workout assignment pretty easily and the final test is soooooooo easy. Take her, it's an easy A.
Dorris Morris rocks! Her class is SOOO easy!
Terrible! Stay away from this one!

manadatory attendance which was obvious being its tennis. but the whole class is based on a skills assessment test that you take at the end.if you mess up just a little your bound for a B in the class which kind of ticked me off. I won all my matchs, attended everyday but because I didnt do well on skills assessment I made a B in the class.

Dont bother doing her homework, she'll make a promise that she'll take it into consideration for your final grade if you do it. Just don't do it, its a lie. Her quizes are nothing like the stupid homework assignments anyway, so its just a waste of time. Class is easy though, its just hard for me to like someone that doesnt keep their word.
I really liked this teacher she was really fun. I had a great time in her classes and learned a great deal. She tries to keep the class interesting. Students should really take her class.
She is so nice. I wanted to take her for tennis but her class filled up and I had to take it w/ another prof. and she subbed one day for my class and it was so much fun with her. Take her!
She is a very nice! I liked her class but her test and labs are hard.
She is an awesome prof. Take her!

Great teacher! Loved her. Works well with students and acutally cares. I told her I had a rough week and she let me take my test 3 days late. Take her! All you have to do for the test is read. Super easy A.
awsome teach very helpful tests on numbers and stats not just general material

She's a nice person, but takes the class wayyy too seriously. Most people are just taking the class because it's required, not because they actually want to learn about exercise, but she doens't seem to realize that. Labs are easy, you need to read your text for the tests though. You will do exericse. Nice person, not so much as a teacher.
